title: The Portrait of a Lady - suavity

content.question: In context, the end of the second sentence (“although by no means . . . impression of suavity”) suggests that Mrs. Touchett

choices.label: fails to appear gracious in spite of her generous impulses
fails to impress in spite of her intelligent political opinions
receives little social attention because of her thrifty habits
fails to charm in spite of her reserved manners

content.answer: fails to appear gracious in spite of her generous impulses

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Identify and describe what specific textual details reveal about a character, that character's perspective, and that character's motives.
